title: Ayurvedic Face Cleanser — Sandal & Chickpea Flour
excerpt: A gentle, powder cleanser using besan (chickpea flour), sandalwood and a touch of turmeric—cleansing and cooling for Pitta-prone skin.
content:
## What Is This Ayurvedic Face Cleanser?
A traditional-style powder cleanser and facial pack combining besan (chickpea flour), sandalwood powder, and a small amount of turmeric. Mix into a paste with rose water to cleanse without stripping natural oils.

## Ayurvedic Significance
Besan provides gentle cleansing and mild exfoliation; sandalwood cools and soothes Pitta; turmeric offers mild antiseptic and brightening support when used in small amounts.

### Key Benefits
- Cleanses gently without harsh surfactants.
- Cooling and calming for Pitta-prone skin.
- Can be used as a weekly face-wash or mask.

## Ingredients
- Besan (chickpea flour)
- Sandalwood powder
- Turmeric (small amount)

## Usage Instructions
- Mix 1–2 teaspoons of powder with rose water to form a smooth paste. Massage gently for 30–60 seconds, then rinse.
- Use 2–3 times weekly as a gentle cleanser or once weekly as a mask.

## Packaging
- Powder sachet with mixing guide and frequency recommendations.

## Safety & Consultation
- Patch-test before use; avoid on broken skin. If you have sensitive or rosacea-prone skin, consult a dermatologist before routine use.

## Why Choose This Cleanser?
A return to simple, plant-based cleansing that respects the skin’s natural balance and Ayurvedic dosha recommendations.
